articles.author: FARNOUSH AMIRI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said he is launching an impeachment inquiry against President Joe Biden, yielding to mounting pressure from former President Donald Trump and his allies in what's shaping up as an election-year clash between Congress and the White House.
articles.title: What's ahead now that Republicans are opening an impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden

articles.author: ADRIAN SAINZ and JONATHAN MATTISE
articles.description: MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) — Five former Memphis police officers were charged Tuesday with federal civil rights violations in the beating death of Tyre Nichols as they continue to fight second-degree murder charges in state courts arising from the killing.
articles.title: 5 former officers charged with federal civil rights violations in Tyre Nichols beating death

articles.author: MICHAEL LIEDTKE
articles.description: CUPERTINO, Calif. (AP) — Apple on Tuesday unveiled its next generation of iPhones — a line-up that will boast better cameras, faster processors, a new charging system and a price hike for the fanciest model.
articles.title: Apple’s new iPhones get faster chips, better cameras and new charging ports

articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — Emergency workers uncovered more than 1,500 bodies in the wreckage of Libya’s eastern city of Derna on Tuesday, and it was feared the toll could spiral with 10,000 people reported still missing after floodwaters smashed through dams and washed away entire neighborhoods of the city.
articles.title: 10,000 people are missing and thousands are feared dead as eastern Libya is devastated by floods

articles.author: SAM METZ
articles.description: An earthquake has sown destruction and devastation in Morocco, where death and injury counts continue to rise after rescue crews dug out people both alive and dead in villages that were reduced to rubble.
articles.title: What to know about the Morocco earthquake and the efforts to help

articles.author: PAUL WISEMAN and MICHAEL LIEDTKE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Google has exploited its dominance of the internet search market to lock out competitors and smother innovation, the Department of Justice said Tuesday at the opening of the biggest U.S.
articles.title: US claims Google pays more than $10 billion a year to maintain its search dominance

articles.author: CLAIRE SAVAGE and COREY WILLIAMS
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — It took four and a half months for Shannon Ross’ life to unravel.Ross, who describes himself as Indigenous and a person of color, was arrested in Chicago in October 2019 on weapons charges and ultimately found not guilty.
articles.title: Cash bail disproportionately impacts communities of color. Illinois is the first state to abolish it

articles.author: MARYCLAIRE DALE and MARC LEVY
articles.description: POTTSTOWN, Pa. (AP) — Escaped murderer Danelo Souza Cavalcante stole a rifle from a garage and fled a homeowner's gunfire, authorities said Tuesday as police closed roads in a rural stretch of southeastern Pennsylvania, told residents to lock their doors and set up a new search area in the nearly 2-week-old manhunt.
articles.title: Escaped Pennsylvania inmate stole rifle, fled homeowner's gunfire and remains at large, police say

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — During her husband’s 1992 presidential campaign, Hillary Clinton observed that “our lives are a mixture of different roles” and said most people are trying to find the right balance.
articles.title: Hillary Clinton is stepping over the White House threshold in yet another role

articles.author: KRISTIE RIEKEN
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — It’s almost 10 p.m. and still a sweltering, sticky 95 degrees when Texas Southern’s Ocean of Soul band marches onto the top of a parking garage a stone’s throw from downtown Houston.
articles.title: For HBCUs, the bands are about much more than the show to the Black community: 'This is family'
